agency_desc: A commercial organization that provides outpatient medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction utilizing methadone and buprenorphine.
service_description: Provides outpatient services to individuals who are addicted to opioids. Services include medications, counseling, and referrals to other agencies as needed. Group, individual, and family addictions counseling is available.
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment,
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Addicted to or dependent on opiates

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information. www.tsc.k12.in.us
site_eligibility: Students living within the Tippecanoe school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing a support group for miscarriage and infant loss in Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Provides a support group to parents struggling with miscarriage or infant loss.
site_details: Walk in. -- Online support group is also available. -- Visit www.facebook.com/supportgroupopenarms for online support group.

agency_name: INDIANA HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY - BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE
agency_desc: This is not a true agency record, but rather a collection of lead regional agencies providing coordinated entry services to individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
site_name: REGION 4 - LEAD AGENCY - LTHC HOMELESS SERVICES
service_description: Leads housing intake, assessment, referrals, and placement coordination for individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
nameLevel3: At Risk/Homeless Housing Related Assistance Programs
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, or White County -- Currently and chronically homeless (living on the street, unable to obtain shelter, or living in uninhabitable conditions)

agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, and White County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, or White County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services and social activities for youth and adults who are recovering from substance use.
service_description: Provides recovery group that is designed to prevent relapse by reducing social isolation, providing positive modeling behaviors, encouraging honest feedback, and increasing emotional support.
site_details: Visit website, send an email, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Provides recovery group (Recovery Circle) that is designed to prevent relapse by reducing social isolation, providing positive modeling behaviors, encouraging honest feedback, and increasing emotional support.

site_eligibility: Individuals who have been drug and alcohol-free 24 hours prior to visit

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including multiple recovery support groups.
service_description: Provides multiple support groups that support, encourage, and offer fellowship to those affected by alcohol or substance use disorder. Support groups available for youth, teens, adults, and anyone affected by alcohol or substance use disorder. Snack bag and childcare for youth under four provided for free. Meal also provided.
site_details: Walk in at designated time, or stream on Facebook Live -- For questions: Send an email to Donna Zoss at zossd@purdue.edu
site_eligibility:
○Youth age 4-12 (with family members that have alcohol or substance use disorder) 
○Teens (with alcohol or substance use disorder or family members who have alcohol or substance use disorder) 
○Adults (with alcohol or substance use disorder or family members who have alcohol or substance use disorder)

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: Offers self-help support groups, networking and information throughout the state in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences.
service_description: Offers support groups in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences. This area has meetings in Crawford, Lawrence, and Monroe County.
site_details: Call or visit website for meeting times and locations. -- All meetings are walk-in only.
site_schedule: Automated Information Line: Daily 24 Hours -- Meetings: Vary
site_eligibility: Closed Meetings: Addicts or those who think they may have a drug problem -- Open Meetings: Anyone wishing to experience narcotics anonymous fellowship

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
site_name: THE VILLAGES - NORTH CENTRAL INDIANA - LAFAYETTE
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
service_description: Provides legal guidance and representation to low-income individuals in civil matters, such as family law, senior law, consumer law, housing issues, and public benefits. Preference is given to legal problems that prevent clients from meeting their basic needs. No criminal or fee-generating cases accepted.
site_details: Call during service hours or complete online application. Be prepared to answer questions about household income and assets.
site_eligibility: Income 125% of Federal Poverty Level -- With a civil legal issue that does not generate fees

agency_name: BUREAU OF CHILD DEVELOPMENT SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A government agency assuring Indiana families with infants and toddlers experiencing developmental delays or disabilities have access to early intervention services close to home when they need them through a coordinated system of local inter-agency councils called First Steps.
site_name: FIRST STEPS OF MID-NORTH INDIANA - CLUSTER D
service_description: Serves as an entry point for infants and toddlers who have or are at risk for developmental delays. Services include home-based special instruction; occupational, physical, and speech therapy; access to health and social services; and case management.
taxonomy_name: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
nameLevel3: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Benton, Boone, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Fountain, Howard, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren or White County -- Ages 0-3 -- With, or at risk for, developmental delays

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men and women who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_schedule: Men's Classes: Mon 10am; Thurs 3pm and 6pm; Fri 6pm -- Women's Classes: Tues 10am and 6pm
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that creates personalized, professionally crafted caskets or urns for newborns and infants who have passed away.
service_name: NEWBORN AND INFANT BURIAL EXPENSE ASSISTANCE
service_description: Offers free or reduced cost caskets or urns for families experiencing the loss of an newborn or infant.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- Experiencing loss of newborn or infant -- Financial need

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization dedicated to reducing the physical and financial burdens of cancer.
service_description: Provides assistance to cancer patients and their families. Assistance may include: client advocacy, durable medical equipment, food, cleaning supplies, medical transportation, wigs, and financial assistance.
site_details: Visit www.communitycancernetwork.net/applicants to apply. -- Application can be returned by email, fax, or mail.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- Cancer diagnosis

site_details: Visit www.communitycancernetwork.net/applicants to apply. -- Application can be returned by email, fax, or mail.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- Cancer diagnosis

agency_desc: The purpose of the International Center is to foster global, cross-cultural cooperation and understanding among residents of the Greater Lafayette area.
service_description: Offers English as a second language (ESL) instruction for persons who speak little or no English.
site_details: Call for more information about ESL classes.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- Ages 15 or older

agency_desc: The purpose of the International Center is to foster global, cross-cultural cooperation and understanding among residents of the Greater Lafayette area.
service_description: Offers an conversation group where people can strengthen their English and meet with others that are also trying to learn English.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County

agency_name: MARY T. KLINKER VETERANS RESOURCE CENTER
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers resources to veterans, including financial assistance.
site_name: MARY T. KLINKER VETERANS RESOURCE CENTER
service_description: Offers limited financial assistance to veterans living in Tippecanoe County. Financial assistances can help with utility bills, rent, transportation to work or medical appointments, phone minutes, food assistance, work clothing, medication, and other items deemed crucial to stability. Assistance is given on a case-by-case basis.
site_details: Call to request financial assistance.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- Veteran -- Financial need

agency_desc: A nonprofit animal shelter that offers feral cat rescue and adoption services.
service_description: Provides shelter and adoption services for unwanted and rehabilitated cats in Tippecanoe County
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit animal shelter that offers feral cat rescue and adoption services.
service_description: Offers veterinary screenings, rehabilitation, socialization, and other services for homeless and at risk cats.
site_details: Call to determine course of action for sick cat.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- Cats that are homeless, sick, injured, or motherless kittens

agency_desc: A nonprofit animal shelter that offers feral cat rescue and adoption services.
service_description: Offers low-cost spay/neuter services, ear-tipping, vaccinations, and medical care for unowned, feral cats.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- Unowned, feral cats

agency_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE ON MENTAL ILLNESS - WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides mental health education and support groups for people with mental illness and their families.
site_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE ON MENTAL ILLNESS - WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
service_description: Offers support and information for individuals with mental illness. This support group is open to individuals with any type of mental illness.
site_details: Walk in. -- Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Individuals with any form of serious or chronic mental illness

agency_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE ON MENTAL ILLNESS - WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides mental health education and support groups for people with mental illness and their families.
site_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE ON MENTAL ILLNESS - WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
service_description: Offers an education program for individuals who have a loved one with a mental illness. The course is taught by trained family members of individuals with mental illness, and focuses on schizophrenia, bipolar disorder (manic depression), clinical depression, panic disorder, and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit www.nami-wci.org/services/education, call, or email jmabbitt@nami-wci.org to register.
site_eligibility: Family members or loved ones of individuals diagnosed with a serious mental illness

agency_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE ON MENTAL ILLNESS - WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides mental health education and support groups for people with mental illness and their families.
site_name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE ON MENTAL ILLNESS - WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
service_description: Provides face-to-face crisis intervention for individuals with mental health emergencies. The objective is to defuse the critical nature of the situation, ensure the person's safety, and return the individual to a state of equilibrium in which they are capable of identifying and seeking solutions to the problem. Additional assistance through ongoing support and resources may be provided.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in
site_eligibility: Individuals suffering from a mental health crisis

agency_name: NORTH CENTRAL INDIANA SPAY AND NEUTER
agency_desc: NCISN is endeavoring to reduce the suffering, abandonment, and neglect of companion animals in our community, and reach a goal of no more homeless pets.
site_name: NORTH CENTRAL INDIANA SPAY AND NEUTER
service_description: Offers financial assistance for spay/neuter services. All procedures are done at Precious Paws Clinic.
site_details: Call, text, or email to request spay/neuter assistance.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- Assistance is only available for those on Medicaid, food stamps, housing or energy assistance, or living with a disability

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers financial assistance scholarships for people in living in Benton, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Fountain, Howard, Miami, Montgomery, Tipton, Tippecanoe, Warren, and White County.
service_description: Offer financial support, up to $150, to help eligible applicants address current barriers while seeking better long-term career opportunities. Examples of potential uses of financial assistance funds include high school equivalency testing fees, work boots, bus passes/transportation, certification fees, etc.
site_details: Visit www.adultlearnersinc.org/scholarships to apply online. Application deadlines: Jan Scholarship: Dec 1st -- April Scholarship: March 1st -- July Scholarship: June 1st -- Oct Scholarship: Sept 1st.
site_eligibility: Living in Benton, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Fountain, Howard, Miami, Montgomery, Tipton, Tippecanoe, Warren, or White County -- Age 18 or older -- Financial need -- Has not previously earned a 4-year degree -- Limit assistance once per year

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides educational, after school programs for students.
service_description: Provides an arts after-school program to grades K-12. Registration is on a first come, first served basis.
site_details: Visit www.theartsfederation.org more more information. -- Call to register for after school programs.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- K-12 grade

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: The state government entity responsible for state tax matters, including collecting state taxes, administering state tax laws, and creating tax policy.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE - LAFAYETTE DISTRICT
service_description: Answers questions about state income taxes, provides state tax forms, handles state tax collections and assists with setting up payment arrangements, and submits completed state tax returns (paper filing only). Assistance is provided by phone, email, or on a walk-in basis. Automated information is available 24 hours per day by phone.
site_details: Walk in, call, or send questions by email. -- For phone assistance, follow the phone prompts to hear recorded information by topic or to speak with a live representative. State or federal tax ID number may be required.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The state government entity responsible for state tax matters, including collecting state taxes, administering state tax laws, and creating tax policy.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE - LAFAYETTE DISTRICT
service_description: Answers questions about state income taxes, provides state tax forms, handles state tax collections and assists with setting up payment arrangements, and submits completed state tax returns (paper filing only). Assistance is provided by phone, email, or on a walk-in basis. Automated information is available 24 hours per day by phone.
site_details: Walk in, call, or send questions by email. -- For phone assistance, follow the phone prompts to hear recorded information by topic or to speak with a live representative. State or federal tax ID number may be required.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The Indiana Department of Health supports Indiana's economic prosperity and quality of life by promoting, protecting, and providing for the health of Hoosiers in their communities.
site_name: BREAST AND CERVICAL CANCER PROGRAM (BCCP) - CENTRAL REGION
service_description: Provides access to free or low-cost breast and cervical cancer screenings, diagnostic testing, and treatment for women who are uninsured or underinsured. Services provided may include colposcopies, liquid-based cytology tests, high risk panel HPV testing, office visits, pelvic exams/tests, clinical breast exams (CBEs), screening and/or diagnostic mammograms, diagnostic breast ultrasounds, breast biopsies, and consultations. Regional coordinators conduct eligibility assessments and provide referrals to local care providers as well as Medicaid (MA-12) Option 3 Treatment Program enrollment assistance (for those who receive a cancer diagnosis).
site_details: Visit website for additional information and income guidelines. -- Call to request an eligibility assessment.
site_eligibility:
For BCCP: Female resident of Indiana -- With household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Uninsured or underinsured (such as having a high or unmet deductible)

For Services: Age 30-49 for office visit, clinical breast exam, and Pap test -- Age 50-64 for office visit, clinical breast exam, Pap test, and mammogram -- Age 65 or older and not enrolled in Medicare Part B for office visit, clinical breast exam, Pap test, and mammogram

For MA-12 Option 3 Treatment Program: Female residents of Indiana -- Age 18-64 -- Diagnosed with breast or cervical cancer -- Entering or actively receiving treatment -- Not enrolled in Medicare -- Uninsured or with insurance not covering cancer treatment -- With household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level

For MA-12 Option 3 Treatment Program: Female residents of Indiana -- Age 18-64 -- Diagnosed with breast or cervical cancer -- Entering or actively receiving treatment -- Not enrolled in Medicare -- Uninsured or with insurance not covering cancer treatment -- With household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level

service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.

site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

The Financial Assistance Application may also be printed from the website.
site_eligibility: Received medically necessary health care services from a Franciscan Alliance provider (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income for sliding-scale assistance; those below 200% of Federal Poverty Level may be eligible for assistance

service_description: Serves as the access point to connect persons age 60 and older, and persons with disabilities to human services. Area Agencies on Aging are responsible for coordinating, planning, and funding person-centered home- and community-based services, which may include: advocacy, case management, and health care coordination, comprehensive information and referral, congregate and home-delivered meals, government subsidies issued for assisted living options, and transportation services.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Persons of any age with physical disabilities and their caregivers

service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Tippecanoe County (5 miles outside of Lafayette/West Lafayette area), as well as Carroll, Clinton, and White County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently OPEN. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Walk in to pick up an application for the wait list. -- People already on the wait list, call or walk in to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: Household income below set limits -- Preference given to families with children, seniors, and people with disabilities

Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.
site_details: Call for an initial assessment and to be placed on a wait list. An in-home assessment and application will be scheduled when the wait is up.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older or any age with physical disabilities -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance (based on assessment) -- Income requirements vary by funding source

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides early head start and head start services, including safe sleep education, family and youth services.
service_description: Provides home-based case management and advocacy for families with children up to age 17. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing parenting education and connecting families to local resources, including safe sleep education and cribs to families of children less than one year of age. May be able tp provide financial for baby formula to those who do not qualify for WIC.
site_details: Call for information or apply online; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS) or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open Juvenile Probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_desc: A nonprofit partnership of congregations and community organizations providing shelter services to persons in need.
service_description: Provides shelter for single persons with children, couples with children, or pregnant women. Children may be up to age 18, regardless of gender. Local congregations provide overnight accommodations, transportation, and volunteer support. Day Center support services include case management, assistance finding employment and housing, transportation to medical appointments, and offers shower and laundry facilities. Shelter works with Lafayette Transitional Housing to begin intake process, there may be a wait list upon availability.
site_details: Call Lafayette Transitional Housing to begin intake process. -- Clients may be referred based on bed availability.
site_eligibility: Homeless persons with children (age 18 or younger) -OR- pregnant women -- Agree to a criminal history background check

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA WABASH VALLEY REGION
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency working to advocate, educate and improve mental health in Tippecanoe County.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA - WABASH VALLEY REGION
service_description: Offers support services to people who have faced difficulties connecting with mental health services or providers. Navigators work with client to create a personalized plan to navigate through the mental health system. Each plan is personal but may include help linking to care for mental health and or addictions; help with making appointments, going over insurance, getting clinic wait times, and what options are available in the area.
site_details: Call or walk-in and make an appointment to speak with a Mental Health Navigator.
site_eligibility: Open

service_description: Offers training on how to recognize a crisis and the warning signs that someone may be contemplating suicide. agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
service_description: Provides minor home repairs to area senior/disabled adult homeowners in need. Repairs may include minor plumbing, roof leaks, electrical problems, or installation of grab bars and hot water heater replacement. Emergency repair service is not included. Mobile homes do not qualify.
site_details: Call for information or to apply; an intake interview and home inspection is required.
site_eligibility: Living within Lafayette or West Lafayette city limits in Tippecanoe County -- Age 62 or older or adults with a permanent disability -- Meet income guidelines (based on assessment) -- Own and occupy the home

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Tippecanoe County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

service_description: Offers weather alert radios to Tippecanoe persons in need, while supplies last. Weather alert radios provide information for emergencies including hazardous weather, local area warnings, and current weather conditions from the National Weather Service.
site_details: Call for availability or to make a request.
site_eligibility: Modular manufactured housing occupants

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years-old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.

site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for information.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Conducts local health fairs, provides health education services to the public, and maintains the lending library and other information resources for the County.
site_details: Call for information about arranging a group presentation.
site_eligibility: Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers free Plan B One-Step to women to prevent pregnancy. It does not prevent fertilized eggs from implanting in the womb, and does not effect an existing pregnancy. Instead it prevents pregnancy by acting on ovulation. Testing for sexually transmitted infection is required to receive Plan B One-Step.
site_details: Call for information or appointment.
site_eligibility: Women - Living in Tippecanoe County - Willing to be tested for sexually transmitted infection

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
site_name: TIPPECANOE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT - ENVIRONMENTAL AND FOODS  DIVISION
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Tippecanoe County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Tippecanoe County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Tippecanoe County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Tippecanoe County. A seven-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Tippecanoe County

site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides transportation to medical appointments for area veterans to the Indianapolis, IN and Danville, IL veterans' hospitals. Vehicle is not wheelchair accessible.
site_details: Call to schedule your transportation as soon as you've scheduled appointment.
site_schedule: To Indianapolis: Mon-Wed; To Danville, IL: Thurs
site_eligibility: Veterans living in Tippecanoe County -- With an appointment at the Indianapolis, Indiana or Danville, Illinois veterans hospital -- Able to enter and exit vehicle unassisted

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization dedicated to eliminating racism, empowering women, and promoting peace, justice, freedom, and dignity for all.
service_description: Provides dating and domestic violence education and outreach to teens, parents, and the community. Information includes recognizing and safely ending abusive relationships, helping friends or family members who are being abused, information about workplace violence, the importance of consent, and fostering healthy relationships. Ongoing support services are available to teens who have left an abusive relationship. Available for group presentations to schools, churches, and community organizations.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or to request a group presentation.www.ywcalafayette.org
site_eligibility: Teens (junior and senior high school), their parents, friends, or other loved ones

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization dedicated to eliminating racism, empowering women, and promoting peace, justice, freedom, and dignity for all.
service_description: As the only rape crisis center in western central Indiana, YWCA creates an environment in which survivors feel safe and empowered, and reduce the trauma experienced by survivors. Trained advocates help survivors provide compassionate support at any point during a survivor’s healing journey. Additional services provided include hospital/medical advocacy, criminal justice advocacy,  and community awareness and outreach.
site_details: Call to speak with an intake specialist
site_eligibility: Victim of a sexual assault

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit providing outreach services, including a thrift store.
site_name: TRINITY LIFE MINISTRY - LIFE RECOVERY PROGRAM FOR MEN
service_description: Provides a faith-based, transitional housing program for men who are recovering from alcohol or drug addiction. Residents participate in peer counseling, Bible study, and community service. Referrals to additional community services are given as needed. Residents are asked to make a five-month commitment and are required to attend church during their stay.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Complete application online or call for information.
site_eligibility: Men -- 18 or older -- Recovering from drug or alcohol dependency -- No sex offenses

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides up to $75 of assistance for utility bills or rent (not both) to a limited number of people monthly. First come, first served.
site_details: Walk in; first come, first served.
site_schedule: Monthly 4th Tues 10am-noon  (or until the funds are gone)
site_eligibility: Household has not received assistance from this agency within the last 3 months (Maximum 4 times per year)

agency_desc: A nonprofit that maintains an animal shelter, offers pet adoptions, and enforces animal-related ordinances.
service_description: Offers donated pet food to Tippecanoe County pet owners in need, based on donations.
site_details: Call to confirm pick up, drive up.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit that maintains an animal shelter, offers pet adoptions, and enforces animal-related ordinances.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items often include pet food, cat litter, and bleach. Cash donations can be in person, by mail, Razoo or Paypal. Volunteers to assist with shelter duties, including dog walking, cleaning, and event assistance are also welcome.
site_details: Call, walk in, or email to make donation arrangements or to inquire about volunteering.
site_eligibility: To Donate: Open -- To Volunteer: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expenses -- Food vouchers -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, and Wed 8am-4:30pm; Thurs 1pm-8pm; Fri 8am-12:30pm
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit serving Greater Lafayette through various outreach programs including an emergency shelter; financial, tax, and immigration assistance; and food pantries.
service_description: Offers financial assistance to help clients in need secure birth certificates and state identification cards. Assistance locating and ordering out-of-state birth certificates is also available.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit serving Greater Lafayette through various outreach programs including an emergency shelter; financial, tax, and immigration assistance; and food pantries.
service_description:
Provides Christmas toys, gift wrap, gift cards, and food to families in need. Limited spots available. Registration is first-come, first-served.

-Each child (age 12 or under)-toys and gift wrap
-Each teen (age 13-18)-gift card
-Each family-food card and meat/protein food card
site_details: Visit https://client.lumserve.org/children-families/jubilee-christmas/ to register. -- Registration opens Wed, Oct 11, 2023 at 4:30pm. -- Call or send an email if no access to the online form. -- If postcard was received in the USPS mail, register online as soon as possible. If no postcard received, register during open registration. -- Approved participants will be assigned in Nov 2023 to a host site for Jubilee Christmas Day. Distribution may be in-person, limited in-person, curbside, or walk through. -- Adult representative who attends must not be sick; must disclose in advance if sick with COVID-19 or flu, or been around someone with COVID-19; may be given a specific appointment; may be required to wear a face mask; may be required to wash hands if entering the building; and may be required to allow for a temperature check.
site_schedule: Online Registration: Wed, Oct 11, 2023 4:30pm -- Distribution: Sat, Dec 9, 2023
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County -- With at least one child age 12 or under as of Dec 9, 2023 -- Below 150% of the federal poverty threshold -- Adult family member MUST have a working phone and email account that is checked regularly -- May only participate in one local Christmas toy assistance program. Once registered for Jubliee Christmas, participant's name will be shared with sponsors of all local assistance programs such as American Red Cross, Bauer Family Resources, Lyn Treece Boys & Girls Club, Wabash Valley Alliance, Faith Church, and The Salvation Army.

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit serving Greater Lafayette through various outreach programs including an emergency shelter; financial, tax, and immigration assistance; and food pantries.
service_description: Provides immigration information and assistance completing and filing forms in the following areas: Gaining citizenship; getting considered for Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) renewal; applying for emergency visas or green cards; adjustment of status; consular processing; Deferred Action for Parents of Americans and Lawful Permanent Residents (DAPA); employment authorization; family-based petitions; naturalization/citizenship; Temporary Protected Status (TPS); U visas; and Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) petitions.
site_details: Call, text, send an email, or visit website to schedule an appointment. No walk-ins allowed.
site_schedule: Phones Answered: Mon-Fri 8:15am-4:30pm -- Assistance: Mon-Fri 10am-3pm; by appointment only
site_eligibility: Living in Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, or White County

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit serving Greater Lafayette through various outreach programs including an emergency shelter; financial, tax, and immigration assistance; and food pantries.
site_name: LAFAYETTE URBAN MININSTRY - RAY EWRY CENTER
service_description: Provides overnight shelter to single men and women experiencing homelessness. Shower facilities and morning/evening meals are also offered. Clients must leave the shelter every day from 7am-9pm and are required to take their personal items.
site_details: Weekdays: Walk in to the main office (420 N 4th St) between 7am-11am to receive a guest pass. -- Weekends: Walk in to the shelter office (525 N 4th St) at 7am to receive a guest pass. -- Call for information.
site_schedule: Office/Weekday Passes: Mon-Fri 7am-11am -- Shelter/Weekend Passes: Sat, Sun, and holidays 7am
site_eligibility: Single men and women -- Age 18 or older

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing outpatient mental health services, teen substance abuse prevention, and family preservation programs.
service_description: Offers a free ten-week workshop for parents or guardians of teenagers. Participants meet for 90 minutes each week to learn attachment based strategies aimed at building or rebuilding stronger connections with teens. Space is limited; registration is required.
site_details: Call, email, or visit the website for more information or to register.
site_schedule: Office: Mon 8am-5pm; Tues 10am-8pm; Wed and Thurs 10am-6pm; Fri 8am-2pm -- Program schedule varies; call for details.
site_eligibility: Parents, guardians, or primary caregivers of teenagers (ages 13-18)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing outpatient mental health services, teen substance abuse prevention, and family preservation programs.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for children and adults experiencing life challenges, relationship difficulties, mental health issues, or substance use and dependence. Services include initial assessment as well as individual, group, and family counseling. In-person and telehealth appointments available.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office for information or to placement on client waiting list; be prepared to provide name and contact details. -- Walk-ins not accepted.
site_schedule: Office: Mon 8am-5pm; Tues 10am-8pm; Wed and Thurs 10am-6pm; Fri 8am-2pm --
site_eligibility: Age 5 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing outpatient mental health services, teen substance abuse prevention, and family preservation programs.
service_description: Offers a six-week, evidence based video and discussion program for parents or guardians of young children up to age 12. Participants meet for two hours each week to learn strategies to encourage child resilience, build positive communication, and gain effective parenting tools. Space is limited; registration is required.
site_details: Call, email, or visit the website for more information or to register.
site_schedule: Office: Mon 8am-5pm; Tues 10am-8pm; Wed and Thurs 10am-6pm; Fri 8am-2pm -- Program schedule varies; day and evening meetings times typically available.
site_eligibility: Parents, guardians, or primary caregivers of young children (ages infant through 12)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing outpatient mental health services, teen substance abuse prevention, and family preservation programs.
service_description: Provides a free five-week substance use education and prevention workshop for Tippecanoe County youth in grades 9-12. Participants meet for two hours each week to learn about substances they may encounter and the potential health, personal, and legal consequences of using those substances. Space is limited; registration is required.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call, email, or visit the website for program information or upcoming workshop dates. -- Teen and their parent/guardian are required to complete an initial assessment prior to workshop attendance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon 8am-5pm; Tues 10am-8pm; Wed and Thurs 10am-6pm; Fri 8am-2pm -- Program schedule varies.
site_eligibility: Tippecanoe County youth in grades 9-12

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing outpatient mental health services, teen substance abuse prevention, and family preservation programs.
service_description: Provides a free five-week substance use education and prevention workshop for Tippecanoe County youth in grades 9-12. Participants meet for two hours each week to learn about substances they may encounter and the potential health, personal, and legal consequences of using those substances. Space is limited; registration is required.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call, email, or visit the website for program information or upcoming workshop dates. -- Teen and their parent/guardian are required to complete an initial assessment prior to workshop attendance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon 8am-5pm; Tues 10am-8pm; Wed and Thurs 10am-6pm; Fri 8am-2pm -- Program schedule varies.
site_eligibility: Tippecanoe County youth in grades 9-12

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Tippecanoe County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Tippecanoe County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Tippecanoe County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Board Meetings: 1st and 3rd Mon 10am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Tippecanoe County, including patching, paving, snow removal, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Tippecanoe County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Tippecanoe County)

agency_desc: An entity of Tippecanoe County government dedicated to protecting the rights of local citizens and assists victims of discriminatory practices in Tippecanoe county.
service_description: Investigates claims of discrimination in education, employment, public accommodations, and housing in Tippecanoe County, except Lafayette and West Lafayette cities. The commission may attempt to resolve the dispute through mediation, or it may conduct an investigation.
site_details: Call or walk in to speak to intake office staff or request complaint forms. Forms may be downloaded on the website. -- After the initial inquiry, complaints must be filed either by personal delivery, mail, or fax.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Meetings: noon-1:30pm 3rd Mon of March, June, Sept, and December
site_eligibility: All who feel they have been harmed by a discriminatory practice, if the alleged discrimination: Involved education, employment, credit, housing, or public accommodations   -- Was based on race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, sexual orientation, having children (housing/accommodations only), or disability -- Took place in Tippecanoe County (excluding Lafayette and West Lafayette) -- Occurred (or within the past year, for housing)

agency_desc: Offers career and technical education programs, adult education, high school equivalency, and English as a new language classes, and provides a test site for the high school equivalency exam.
service_name: INDIANA HIGH SCHOOL EQUIVALENCY TEST - LAFAYETTE
service_description: Serves as an official testing center for Indiana's high school equivalency test, which enables people who did not complete high school to earn a high school equivalency diploma. Testing at this location takes place twice a month and is available in computer format.
site_details: Call or visit website to enroll.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older (recommended); age 16-17 years-old may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public  school system -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_desc: Offers career and technical education programs, adult education, high school equivalency, and English as a new language classes, and provides a test site for the high school equivalency exam.
service_description: Offers free English as a second language (ESL) courses open to beginners as well as more advanced English speakers.
site_details: Call or visit website to enroll.
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school -- Native language is not English

agency_name: AREA FOUR AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAMS - TRANSPORTATION
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area IV), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, or White County.
site_name: AREA FOUR AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAMS - TRANSPORTATION
service_description: Provides public transportation services to persons living within set areas of Non urbanized Tippecanoe County. Wheelchair accessible van is available upon request. All trips must end outside urbanized areas.
site_details: Call 48 hours in advanced to reserve a spot. --  Medicaid recipients: Call SouthEasTrans
site_eligibility: In need of transportation for a medical need.

agency_name: AREA FOUR AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAMS - TRANSPORTATION

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in the city of West Lafayette in Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks and SNAP.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A non-profit organization offering education and consulting assistance to all homeowners and potential homeowners regardless of income.
service_description: Offers financial assistance to low- to moderate-income area homeowners for critical home repairs that affect the health and safety of the occupants (leaking roof, non-working furnace). A grant of up to $7,500 is available to eligible homes; first-come, first-served basis. This program is dependent on grant availability and usually becomes available in March.
nameLevel4: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Services
site_details: Complete online interest form -OR- call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Own and occupy the home for at least 18 months -- Mortgage must be current and could not have been delinquent within the past year -- Must be current on all property taxes -- Meet household income guidelines (80% of Area Median Income or less). Dependent on HomesteadCS receiving grant from funder.

agency_desc: A non-profit organization offering education and consulting assistance to all homeowners and potential homeowners regardless of income.
service_description: Provides free classes at various locations in the community regarding the rights and responsibility of tenants and landlords. Registration required.
site_details: Visit website to complete online form, or call register.
site_eligibility: Renter or prospective renter

agency_desc: A non-profit organization offering education and consulting assistance to all homeowners and potential homeowners regardless of income.
service_description: Offers financial education , credit counseling, and budget counseling assistance to help consumers set and meet financial goals. Topics include credit and credit reporting, debt, scams and predatory lending, student loan debt  and savings.
site_details: Call or regster online.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A non-profit organization offering education and consulting assistance to all homeowners and potential homeowners regardless of income.
service_description: Offers HUD-certified housing counseling to current and prospective homeowners. Services include pre-purchase classes and individual counseling; mortgage default counseling to people who are facing foreclosure or are behind in payments (will help clients work with their mortgage company to resolve default); reverse mortgage counseling and other alternatives for seniors; and information on predatory lending.
site_details: Call or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A network of churches providing charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.

site_eligibility: Not used this pantry within the past calendar month.

agency_name: GIFTS OF GRACE ADOPTION SUPPORT CENTER
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing support services for women considering adoption and their families, domestic and step-parent adoption home studies, and matching services and placement for adoptive families.
site_name: GIFTS OF GRACE ADOPTION SUPPORT CENTER
service_description: Provides free, 24-hour support for women and families considering adoption. Additional services include adoption education, developing a personalized adoption plan, and post-placement support. Birth mothers may also receive assistance with transportation to medical appointments, assistance obtaining medical coverage, job search, and continuing education. Services for prospective adoptive parents include home studies, adoption education and training, matching services, and post-placement supervision.
site_details: Families considering adoption: Walk in or call the office; call or text the Pregnancy Hotline for information and support. -- Prospective adoptive parents: Walk in, email, or call the office for information.
site_eligibility: Families considering adoption who are living in Tippecanoe County or the surrounding areas -- Prospective adoptive parents' eligibility determined on an individual basis

agency_desc: A public university offering four-year and post-graduate education.
service_description: Offers certificate programs, undergraduate and graduate degree programs, and continuing education classes in a variety of fields. This public, regionally accredited institution is part of the Purdue University system.
site_details: Call for information; application may be submitted online.
site_eligibility: High school diploma or high school equivalency test -- Successful application

agency_desc: A public university offering four-year and post-graduate education.
site_name: PURDUE UNIVERSITY - SCHOOL OF VETERINARY MEDICINE
service_description: Provides temporary emergency shelter for pets whose owner is at-risk of homelessness (pending eviction or in need of shelter) or fleeing a domestic violence situation. Acceptance and temporary placement of pet is dependant on foster availability. Referral required.
site_details: Call with client to speak with staff for a phone assessment and to schedule an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Referred by a social service agency, shelter, or 2-1-1 -- Pets owners fleeing a domestic violence situation -OR- at risk of homelessness -- Without a safe place to keep pet during crisis

agency_desc: A public university offering four-year and post-graduate education.
service_description: Provides nonperishable and perishable food to Purdue students, faculty, and staff in need.
site_details: Walk in the back door (across from the Honors College) for service -OR- Call ahead to arrange curbside pickup appointment. -- Several pop-up pantries may also be available across campus several times per week; see website (https://acefoodpantry.wixsite.com/website/copy-of-student-leaders) for current locations.
site_eligibility: Purdue student, faculty or staff

agency_desc: A nonprofit food bank that serves charities helping people in need with food, critical grocery products, information, and advocacy.

agency_desc: A nonprofit food bank that serves charities helping people in need with food, critical grocery products, information, and advocacy.
service_description: Provides a grocery store style food pantry offering meat, fresh produce, dairy, eggs, and more. Food items are labeled with a point value. Thirty points are given with each visit to spend on food.
site_details: Walk in. -- First Visit: Complete intake form and meet with a resource coordinator -- Food items are labeled with a point value. Thirty points are given with each visit to spend on food.
site_eligibility: Living in Tippecanoe County: No limit on number of visits -- Living outside Tippecanoe County: Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A USDA-sponsored program that provides information, technical assistance, and training to disabled farmers and ranchers so they may continue farming.
service_description: Assists farmers and agriculture workers who have become disabled (such as amputation, arthritis, cancer, mental/behavioral health problems,visual impairment, etc.) to continue farming by providing information and referral resources, and on-site consultation on rehabilitation technology relating to agricultural work sites.
site_details: Call or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Farmers/agricultural workers and their families -- Limited by any type of physical, cognitive, or illness-related disability

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in the city of West Lafayette in Tippecanoe County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program vouchers for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
service_description: Provides a structured program for men recovering from alcohol or drug addiction. An application and interview are required before admission. Clients must also agree to adhere to all program guidelines and policies, including random drug testing and 12-Step meeting attendance. Successful completion of the program typically takes at least six months.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Recovering from substance abuse and committed to total abstinence from alcohol and other drugs during stay -- Not requiring medically supervised detoxification

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
site_name: HOME WITH HOPE - MATERNAL TREATMENT PROGRAM
service_description: Provides an outpatient treatment program for mothers with newborns and pregnant women struggling with substance use.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Mothers with newborns or pregnant women struggling with substance use
